slides.title: FAQ Builder

content.headline: Answer Questions Before They're Asked
content.subhead: Build a powerful FAQ in 20 minutes

slides.narration: How many times do you answer the same questions? A good FAQ answers them before they're asked, saves you time, builds trust, and helps AI understand your business. Let's build one that works.

slides.title: What You'll Build
slides.narration: We'll gather your most common questions, write clear and helpful answers, organize them logically by category, and make sure people actually find and use your FAQ.

slides.title: Step 1: Gather Questions

sources: What your team wishes people knew
Search terms people use to find you

slides.narration: Start by gathering questions. What do customers ask most often? Check your emails and call logs. Ask your team what they wish customers knew before contacting you. Check competitor FAQs for questions you might miss. Look at search terms people use to find your business.

slides.title: Step 2: Write Answers

formula: Next step or CTA when relevant

example.a: Yes, all estimates are free with no obligation. Schedule online or call us at [number]. Estimates typically take 30 minutes.

slides.narration: Write clear answers. Lead with the direct answer—no 'great question' preamble. Add brief explanation only if needed. Include next steps or a call to action when relevant. Keep answers under one hundred words. Example: 'Do you offer free estimates?' 'Yes, all estimates are free with no obligation. Schedule online or call. Estimates typically take thirty minutes.' Direct, complete, actionable.

slides.title: Step 3: Organize Categories
slides.narration: Organize into categories. Common ones: Getting Started or First Visit, Pricing and Payment, Services Offered, Scheduling and Hours, Policies and Guarantees. Put your most common question category first. Most people scan rather than read everything.

slides.title: Step 4: Make It Findable
slides.narration: Make your FAQ findable. Create a dedicated FAQ page on your website. Add relevant questions to each service page. Include top FAQs in your Google Business Profile. Feed FAQs to your AI assistant for instant answers. Use in email auto-responses. Same content, multiple touchpoints.

slides.title: Pro Tips

tips: Update quarterly based on new questions
Add FAQ link to your email signature
Schema markup helps Google show FAQs in search
Track which FAQs get viewed most

slides.narration: FAQ pro tips. Update quarterly based on new questions you're receiving. Add FAQ link to your email signature. Use schema markup so Google can display your FAQs directly in search results. Track which FAQs get viewed most—those might need more detail.

slides.title: Build Your FAQ
slides.narration: Ready to answer questions before they're asked? Start building your FAQ now—we'll help organize and format it. Or see examples from businesses like yours first. Twenty minutes now saves hours every week.
